pages.text: Mongolarachne was a fossil spider species discovered in Inner Mongolia, dating from the Middle Jurassic period approximately 165 million years ago. Preserved in exceptional detail, this ancient arachnid provides crucial insights into early spider evolution, with morphological characteristics suggesting it belonged to the Juraraneidae family. Its body structure indicates it was likely a ground-dwelling predator with specialized hunting adaptations typical of primitive spider lineages.
Arachnophobes beware! This ancient spider is not for the faint of heart.
